parties.raw_snippet:
THIS TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AGREEMENT (this “Agreement”) is dated as of June 11, 2015, by and between Marathon Petroleum
Company LP (“Shipper”) and Marathon Pipe Line LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“MPL”), both referred to jointly as the “Parties” and each
individually as a “Party”.
parties.reasoning: The opening paragraph of the agreement explicitly names the two contracting entities and labels them "Shipper" and "MPL". This is the standard place to identify the contracting parties.

contract_type.raw_snippet:
TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AGREEMENT
...
Shipper responded to the binding open season and desires to commit to transport a specified volume of Product (as defined below) on the
Pipeline over a multi-year period to destinations as provided in Exhibit C, subject to and upon the terms and conditions of this Agreement;
contract_type.reasoning: The title and the operative sentence describe that one party commits to transport specified volumes of product on the pipeline and the other provides transportation services and rates. The core obligations are transport services and volume commitments.

notice_period.raw_snippet: This Agreement will automatically renew for up to two (2) renewal terms of five (5) years each (each, an “Extension Period”) unless either Party provides the other Party with written notice of its intent to terminate this Agreement at least six (6) months prior to the end of the Initial Term or the then current Extension Period.
notice_period.reasoning: This sentence in Section 2.2 sets the advance written notice required to avoid automatic renewal (i.e., notice to terminate before renewal). It specifies "at least six (6) months prior" to the end of the term/extension period.

expiration_date.raw_snippet:
2.1 This Agreement is effective June 11, 2015 (the “Effective Date”). The Agreement shall continue through the project’s in-service date and
for a period of fifteen (15) years after the project’s in-service date (“Initial Term”). MPL shall provide written notice to Shipper confirming the project’s in-service date.
expiration_date.reasoning: Section 2.1 describes the duration (Initial Term) as continuing through the project's in-service date and for fifteen (15) years after that in-service date. This is the primary expiration/term language (relative term).
expiration_date.normalized_value: through the project’s in-service date and for a period of fifteen (15) years after the project’s in-service date

renewal_term.raw_snippet: This Agreement will automatically renew for up to two (2) renewal terms of five (5) years each (each, an “Extension Period”) unless either Party provides the other Party with written notice of its intent to terminate this Agreement at least six (6) months prior to the end of the Initial Term or the then current Extension Period.
renewal_term.reasoning: Section 2.2 explicitly states that the agreement automatically renews for up to two renewal terms of five years each, subject to the notice described. This is the renewal mechanism and term.
renewal_term.normalized_value: Up to two automatic renewals of 5 years each

agreement_date.raw_snippet:
THIS TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AGREEMENT (this “Agreement”) is dated as of June 11, 2015, by and between Marathon Petroleum
Company LP (“Shipper”) and Marathon Pipe Line LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“MPL”), both referred to jointly as the “Parties” and each
individually as a “Party”.
agreement_date.reasoning: The opening clause uses the phrase "is dated as of June 11, 2015," which states when the agreement is dated/signed.

effective_date.raw_snippet: 2.1 This Agreement is effective June 11, 2015 (the “Effective Date”).
effective_date.reasoning: Section 2.1 explicitly defines the Effective Date as June 11, 2015.

governing_law.raw_snippet:
This Agreement shall be construed and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of Ohio, without recourse to any principles of law governing
conflicts of law, which might otherwise be applicable.
governing_law.reasoning: Section 14 contains the governing law clause specifying the state's laws to apply.
